Diabetic Daycare

A Java-based Type 1 Diabetes simulator to help non-diabetics better understand blood sugar management.

[This project is still in development.]

Date

Summer 2024

Project Type

Java Game

Location

San Francisco, CA

Skills

Programming (Java), Prototyping, System & UI Design, UX Research
Proof-of-concept showing game UI.

Challenge

Friends and family of diabetics often do not understand the basics of diabetes management.

Goal

An educational point-and-click babysitting simulator that can teach non-diabetics
about carb counting, insulin therapy, and the dangerous health
consequences of blood sugar mismanagement.


Milestone 1

Text-based Prototype

During this stage of development:
• Text-only terminal interface
• Can only consume carbs in 30g increments
• Can only inject insulin in 3 unit increments

Primary Goals:
• Designing mathematical blood sugar model
• Fine-tuning insulin and carb "strength" scalars

Designing the Model

This model leverages Gaussian distributions to simulate the absorption rates of both insulin and carbohydrates.

Carbohydrate absorption is variable, peaking between 30 to 120 minutes based on the glycemic index and complexity of the food. Simple carbohydrates are absorbed rapidly, while complex carbohydrates exhibit delayed peaks. Insulin absorption, by contrast, is more consistent, reaching its peak effectiveness at approximately 120 minutes post-injection.

Milestone 2

Visual Design + Low Fidelity GUI

During this stage of development:
• Started GUI
• Added different food options to the game

Next Steps:
• Add physical activity and variable insulin sensitivty
• Add new locations to game (Playground, bedroom, etc.)

Milestone 3

[I'm still working on this part.]
Check back later!
